meanings.definition: Signs or signals that suggest or point to something
meanings.sent1: The footprints left behind were clear indications of the path taken.
meanings.sent2: The doctor looked for indications of the illness in the test results.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful meows were indications that it wanted to play.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gathering in the sky were ominous indications of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's smile was a warm indication of her approval.

meanings.definition: Information that serves as a guide or clue
meanings.sent1: The map provided clear indications of the route to the treasure.
meanings.sent2: The detective followed the indications found at the crime scene.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious note left on the table was an indication of a secret admirer.
meanings.sent4: The old compass was a reliable indication of the direction to go.
meanings.sent5: The recipe book was an invaluable indication for baking the perfect cake.

meanings.definition: Suggestions or hints that something is likely to happen
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds were strong indications of an upcoming rainstorm.
meanings.sent2: The sudden drop in temperature was an indication that winter was approaching.
meanings.sent3: The loud thunder was an indication that a storm was brewing.
meanings.sent4: The early morning traffic was a clear indication of a busy day ahead.
meanings.sent5: The chirping birds outside were pleasant indications of the start of a new day.
